a.span: Preparing today's youth for tomorrow's future.

figcaption.p: Click here to read School Dismissal Updates
Click to visit the Distance Learning Page
Click to access FVSD Mental Health & Wellness Resources

p.a: Click to read the latest issue of the Superintendent's Newsletter

div.div: FVSD has provided important additional guidance for families related to Distance Learning - including a Distance Learning Flow (for 2019-20), Student and Parent Roles and Responsibilities, and Grading & Reporting information.

h3.a: FVSD Extends School Dismissal Through the End of the 2019-20 School Year

div.div: In preparation for Distance Learning, FVSD will be distributing Chromebooks for students that do not have devices available at home to use for Distance Learning. Distribution will take place on Tuesday, March 24th (Middle School) and Wednesday, March 25th (Elementary School). Please click on the headline for more information about Distance Learning in FVSD.

Due to the anticipated 90% chance of rain, FVSD will be postponing the District Art Show that is currently scheduled for next Tuesday, March 10, 2020 to May 19, 2020. We deeply appreciate the many people across the District and community who worked so hard to get things ready for next week. More information and details will be shared in the upcoming weeks, as FVSD plans to reschedule the District Art Show for a date in May 2020. We look forward to hosting the event at the District Office in May, and to once again showcasing the many artistic abilities of our FVSD students.

h3.a: Read the latest issue of the Superintendent's Newsletter

img.alt: Read the latest issue of the Superintendent's Newsletter Featured Photo

div.div: In this issue we cover: Science and History Material Adoption Pilots Letters, 2020-21 Tentative School Calendar, CAASPP, Board of Trustees Celebrates Students and Parents at Middle School Extravaganza, FV Rotary and Kelly Osborn Memorial Foundation Honor 10 FVSD Students, FVSD Goes GOLD!, Measure O Open Houses at Masuda and Courreges and MORE! CLICK TO READ
The Fountain Valley School District is now accepting signups for the 2020/21 Transitional Kindergarten (TK). Please click to see the pre-enrollment form.

FVSD is aware of the recent decision by the Huntington Beach City School District Board of Trustees to move to a community-funded school district. As part of this decision, HBCSD will be releasing interdistrict transfers from neighboring school districts, except students who will be in 5th or 8th grades for the 2020-21 school year. We would like to reassure our families who reside within the FVSD boundaries that we are excited to have you return to FVSD. Please continue to check our website for more information regarding upcoming registration dates and ongoing communication.
Location: Kazou Masuda Middle School 17415 Los Jardines W, Fountain Valley, CA 92708, United States
